intro: Cachrys nematoloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes plants adapted to acidic and nutrient-poor soils. The plant features small, leathery leaves that are typically dark green and elliptical in shape. It produces clusters of white or pinkish flowers in spring, which are followed by small, capsule-like fruits. Cachrys nematoloba is often found in heathlands and coastal areas, thriving in well-drained, sandy soils.
